alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 02 at 11:02AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...AREAS OF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW ALONG THE STERLING HIGHWAY FROM NINILCHIK TO NIKISKI THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... Areas of moderate to heavy snow continue to fall this morning from Ninilchik north along the Sterling Highway to Kenai, Soldotna, and Nikiski. The heaviest and most persistent snowfall has been from Kenai to Ninilchik, where 6 to 20 inches of snow have fallen as of 9 am AKDT. As of 11 am AKDT, the back edge of this band of moderate to heavy snow is over Ninilchik and is continuing to lift north. Expect moderate to heavy snow to continue from Ninilchik north through the next couple of hours before the snow finally tapers off. Expect an additional 1 to 4 inches of snow before the event winds down. Please use caution when traveling. Blowing snow and resuspended snow from vehicles may reduce visibility along area roadways at times.
